description.narrative: Nepal: Compact Development Funding (CDF) is used pre-compact for key project preparation work such as the feasibility and environmental impact studies, engineering designs, baseline surveys, financial management and procurement technical assistance, and other specialized analysis to help MCC determine the final suitability and scope of investments, costs, implementation risks, and mitigation measures.

condition.narrative: (a) Delivery of a completed Disbursement Request, together with the periodic reports required under Section 6.1 of this Agreement, in each case in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period;

(a) Evidence of Tax Exemption Mechanism. MCC is satisfied that the Government has entered into a tax exemption agreement or such other mechanism acceptable to MCC to establish or give effect to Section 5.2(k), and such mechanisms are in full force and effect;

(b) Procurement Agent Services. Designation of an entity or individual to provide procurement agent services, as approved by MCC, until such time as the Government provides to MCC a true and complete copy of the Procurement Agent Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect, and the Procurement Agent engaged thereby is mobilized;
(b) [Delivery of a completed] Quaterly Financial Report [in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period]
(c) [Delivery of a completed] Detailed Financial Plan [in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period]

(c) Fiscal Agent Services. Designation of an entity or individual to provide fiscal agent services, as approved by MCC, until such time as the Government provides to MCC a true and complete copy of the Fiscal Agent Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect, and the Fiscal Agent engaged thereby is mobilized;
(d) [Delivery of a completed] Procurement Performance Report [in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period]
(d) Interim Fiscal Accountability Plan. An approved Interim Fiscal Accountability Plan acceptable to MCC is in effect;
(e) [Delivery of a completed] Conditions Precedent Report [in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, covering the related Disbursement Period]
(e) Satisfaction of each of the conditions set forth in Section 4.4; and

(f) Initial Disbursements to a Permitted Account. Prior to an initial Disbursement of any Grant funding to a Permitted Account, a true and complete copy of each Bank Agreement, duly executed and in full force and effect as of the date of the related Disbursement Request.
Completed timesheets for the Disbursement Period, signed by each relevant member of the MCA-NEPAL and approved by an authorized official, acceptable to MCC

Each of the Government?s representations and warranties set forth in Section 5.1 of this Agreement are true and correct on and as of the date on which the Disbursement Request is submitted and as though made on and as of such date;

Each request for Compensation for MCA-NEPAL staff [to include]: MCA-NEPAL member?s banking information for the payment to the members of MCA-NEPAL (Bank name, account number, routing information (IBAN/SWIFT, etc.), currency for remittance (United States dollars preferred)

For MCA-NEPAL members who are Nepali citizens or permanent residents, an invoice articulating tax amounts due from MCC on a quarterly basis, as well as banking information for the Government account responsible for payment of such income taxes.

If requested by MCC, delivery of a certificate from each of the Government, the Permitted Designees, the Procurement Agent and/or the Fiscal Agent, in each case in form and substance satisfactory to MCC; and
Invoice summarizing eligible costs to be paid in accordance with the Cost Principles; invoice ?certified? by Nepal as true and correct

No material breach of any responsibility, covenant or obligation under this Agreement or any other related agreement (including the Bank Agreement, the Fiscal Agent Agreement, the Procurement Agent Agreement and any Service Provider Contract) by any Permitted Designee has occurred and is continuing on and as of the date of the Disbursement Request;

Section 4.3 Conditions Precedent to the Initial Disbursement for Payments to Government Service Providers. For the avoidance of doubt, payments of Permitted Designee salaries are subject only to the conditions precedent in Section 4.4. MCC's approval of the initial Disbursement Request containing payments for Government Service Providers will be subject to the satisfaction of each of the following conditions (except as such conditions may be waived or deferred by MCC in its sole discretion):
The Government is in compliance with the action plan agreed to in the July 3 implementation letter.
